sen.j: 叡山電鉄株式会社（えいざんでんてつ、Eizan Electric Railway Co.,Ltd.）は、京都市左京区の出町柳駅から八瀬・鞍馬への路線を運営する鉄道事業者。
sen.e: Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. is a railway business operator managing lines between Demachiyanagi Station (Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City) and Yase/Kurama.
Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. is a railway business operator managing lines between Demachiyanagi Station (Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City) and Yase/Kurama.
Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. is a railway business operator managing lines between Demachiyanagi Station in Kyoto City's Sakyo Ward and Yase/Kurama.

sen.j: 本社は京都府京都市左京区田中上柳町25番地の3（出町柳駅隣接）。
sen.e: The address of the head office is 25-3 Tanaka-kamiyanagi-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture (adjacent to Demachiyanagi Station).
The address of the head office is 25-3 Tanaka-kamiyanagi-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture (adjacent to Demachiyanagi Station).
The address of the head office is 25-3 Tanaka-kamiyanagi-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture (adjacent to Demachiyanagi Station).

sen.j: 京福電気鉄道の子会社として設立されたが、2002年から京阪電気鉄道の完全子会社となっている。
sen.e: Established as a subsidiary of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., the Eizan Electric Railway has been a wholly-owned subsidiary of Keihan Electric Railway since 2002.
Established as a subsidiary of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., the Eizan Electric Railway has been a wholly owned subsidiary of Keihan Electric Railway since 2002.
Established as a subsidiary of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., the Eizan Electric Railway has been a wholly owned subsidiary of Keihan Electric Railway since 2002.

sen.j: 叡山電鉄叡山本線・叡山電鉄鞍馬線の2路線を運営している。
sen.e: The Eizan Electric Railway manages the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line.
The Eizan Electric Railway manages the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line.
The Eizan Electric Railway manages two lines, the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line.

sen.j: これらの路線は京福電気鉄道が運営していたが、沿線から市内中心部直通のバス路線充実に加え、京都市電が廃止され他の鉄軌道線との連絡が絶たれたことにより離れ小島状態になり利用客も減少した。
sen.e: The number of passengers using these lines (operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad) decreased because more route buses would go through to the city center and the abandonment of Kyoto City Trams caused the lines to lose connection with other railway tracks.

The number of passengers using these lines (operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad) decreased because more bus routes would go through to the city center and the abandonment of Kyoto City Trams caused the lines to lose connections with other railway tracks.

The number of passengers using these lines (operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad) decreased because more bus routes would go through to the city center and the abandonment of Kyoto City Trams caused the lines to lose connections with other railway tracks.

sen.j: そのため京福電気鉄道は叡山電鉄を設立して、この2路線を分離した。
sen.e: Accordingly, the Keifuku Electric Railroad established the Eizan Electric Railway, thereby separating the management of Eizan Main Line and Kurama Line from the Keifuku Electric Railroad.
Accordingly, the Keifuku Electric Railroad established the Eizan Electric Railway, thereby separating the management of Eizan Main Line and Kurama Line from the Keifuku Electric Railroad.

Accordingly, the Keifuku Electric Railroad established the Eizan Electric Railway, thereby separating the management of two lines, the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line from the Keifuku Electric Railroad.

sen.j: しかし1989年に京阪鴨東線が開業し出町柳駅で連絡するようになると、大阪方面からの利便性が向上し、再び活気を呈するようになった。
sen.e: After Keihan Oto Line was opened in 1989 to be connected with the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line at Demachiyanagi Station, the lines became rejuvenated thanks to the improvement of convenience of passengers from Osaka.

After the Keihan Oto Line was opened in 1989 to be connected with the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line at Demachiyanagi Station, the lines became rejuvenated thanks to the improvement of convenience for passengers from Osaka.

After the Keihan Oto Line was opened in 1989 to be connected with the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line at Demachiyanagi Station, the lines became rejuvenated thanks to the improvement of convenience for passengers from Osaka.

sen.j: 略称は「叡電」（えいでん）。
sen.e: The Eizan Electric Railway is called 'Eiden' for short.
The Eizan Electric Railway is called 'Eiden' for short.
The Eizan Electric Railway is called 'Eiden' for short.

sen.j: ただし、この呼び方は現在の叡山本線が京都電燈の叡山電鉄部であったことに由来し、京福電気鉄道となったあとも、叡山本線・鞍馬線の総称として一般に使われていた。
sen.e: This is originated from the Department of Eizan Electric Railway of Kyoto Dento, to which the current Eizan Main Line belonged; thus the name 'Eiden' has been commonly used for the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line even after the lines came to be owned by the Keifuku Electric Railroad.

This is originated from the Department of Eizan Electric Railway of Kyoto Dento, to which the current Eizan Main Line belonged; thus the name 'Eiden' has been commonly used for the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line even after the lines came to be owned by the Keifuku Electric Railroad.

This is originated from the Department of Eizan Electric Railway of Kyoto Dento, to which the current Eizan Main Line belonged; thus the name Eiden became commonly used for the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line even after the lines came to be owned by the Keifuku Electric Railroad.

sen.j: 分社によって、略称が文字通り会社名の省略形となった。
sen.e: Through split-up of the company, the 'Eiden' literally came to stand for the abbreviation of the company name.
Through split-up of the company, the 'Eiden' literally came to stand for the abbreviation of the company name.
Through the split-up of the company, the name Eiden literally came to stand as an abbreviation for the company name.

sen.j: なお、名古屋市に本社を置く家電量販店の「エイデン」は旧社名の「栄電社」が由来であり叡山電鉄とは全く関係はない。
sen.e: Incidentally, an electronics retail store 'EIDEN Co., Ltd.' (whose head office is in Nagoya City) is originated from the former company name 'Eidensha' and has nothing to do with the Eizan Electric Railway.

Incidentally, an electronics retail store 'EIDEN Co., Ltd.' (whose head office is in Nagoya City) is originated from the former company name 'Eidensha,' but it has nothing to do with the Eizan Electric Railway.

Incidentally, an electronics retail store 'EIDEN Co., Ltd.' (whose head office is in Nagoya City) is originated from the former company name 'Eidensha,' but it has nothing to do with the Eizan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄烏丸線が国際会館駅まで延長され、同駅を中心にバス路線網も再整備されため、左京区岩倉地域の住民が市中心部へ向かう場合などの利用がそちらに移転することになった結果、また利用者が減少しつつあるが、パノラミック電車「きらら」を登場させ、各種イベントを開催するなど積極的な利用者確保を行なっている。
sen.e: Kyoto Municipal Subway/Kyoto City Subway, Karasuma Line was extended to Kokusaikaikan Station and route bus networks were redeveloped around the station; as a result, more residents of Iwakura area in Sakyo Ward came to use the subway and buses rather than the Eizan Electric Railway to go to the city center; however, the Eizan Electric Railway has been working actively to increase the number of passengers by, e.g., introducing Panoramic train 'Kirara' (パノラミック電車「きらら」) and having various kinds of events.

Kyoto Municipal Subway/Kyoto City Subway, Karasuma Line was extended to Kokusaikaikan Station and route bus networks were redeveloped around the station, and as a result more residents of Iwakura area in Sakyo Ward came to use the subway and buses rather than the Eizan Electric Railway to go to the city center; however, the Eizan Electric Railway has been working actively to increase the number of passengers by, e.g., introducing Panoramic train 'Kirara' (パノラミック電車「きらら」) and having various kinds of events.

Kyoto Municipal Subway Karasuma Line was extended to Kokusaikaikan Station and bus-route networks were redeveloped around the station, and as a result more residents of the Iwakura area in Sakyo Ward came to use the subway and buses rather than the Eizan Electric Railway to reach the city center; however, the Eizan Electric Railway has been working actively to increase the number of passengers by, for example, introducing Panoramic train 'Kirara' (パノラミック電車「きらら」) and having various kinds of events.
sen.cmt: Kyoto Municipal Subway Karasuma Line としました。

sen.j: 2005年は、日本放送協会大河ドラマ「義経 (NHK大河ドラマ)」のために鞍馬方面の観光がブームになり、近年にない賑わいを見せた。
sen.e: The broadcast of 'Yoshitsune' (NHK period drama) in 2005 created a boom in visiting Kurama, resulting in a record number of tourists in years.
The broadcast of 'Yoshitsune' (NHK period drama) in 2005 created a boom in visits to Kurama, resulting in record numbers of tourists in succeeding years.
The broadcast of 'Yoshitsune' (NHK period drama) in 2005 created a boom in visits to Kurama, resulting in record numbers of tourists in succeeding years.

sen.j: 設立当時、京福電気鉄道が京阪電気鉄道の関連会社（現在も、京福電気鉄道は京阪電気鉄道の関連会社である）であったものの、デナ500形導入の経緯などから車両技術面では阪神電気鉄道色が強いなど、独特の京福（叡電）色を有していた。
sen.e: When the Eizan Electric Railway was established, the Keifuku Electric Railroad was an affiliate company of the Keihan Electric Railway (the Keifuku Electric Railroad remains an affiliate company of the Keihan Electric Railway), but the Keifuku Electric Railroad (Eiden) had a unique characteristic in that the technology in rolling stock showed a strong influence from Hanshin Electric Railway Co., Ltd. through introduction of Dena Type 500 (デナ500形).

When the Eizan Electric Railway was established, the Keifuku Electric Railroad was an affiliate company of the Keihan Electric Railway (the Keifuku Electric Railroad remains an affiliate company of the Keihan Electric Railway), but the Keifuku Electric Railroad (Eiden) had a unique characteristic in that the technology in rolling stock showed the strong influence of the Hanshin Electric Railway Co., Ltd. through the introduction of the Dena Type 500 (デナ500形).

When the Eizan Electric Railway was established, the Keifuku Electric Railroad was an affiliate company of the Keihan Electric Railway (the Keifuku Electric Railroad remains an affiliate company of the Keihan Electric Railway), but the Keifuku Electric Railroad (Eiden) had a unique characteristic in that the technology in rolling stock showed the strong influence of the Hanshin Electric Railway Co., Ltd. through the introduction of the Dena Type 500.

sen.j: 独立後、1989年の京阪鴨東線開業あたりから、徐々に京阪色も出てきていたが、2002年に京福電気鉄道が京福電気鉄道越前本線列車衝突事故による経営悪化のため所有株を京阪電気鉄道に売却し、同社の完全子会社となって以降、京福色から徐々に京阪色の色合いが濃くなってきている。
sen.e: After being independent and the opening of Keihan Oto Line in 1989, the Eizan Electric Railway gradually showed a characteristic of Keihan; more particularly, after the Keifuku Electric Railroad sold its shares to the Keihan Electric Railway due to its deteriorating conditions caused by the train crash on the Echizen Main Line of the Keifuku Electric Railroad, and became a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Keihan Electric Railway, the Eizan Electric Railway has been gradually showing a characteristic of Keihan rather than Keifuku.

Since becoming independent and the opening of Keihan Oto Line in 1989, the Eizan Electric Railway gradually showed a characteristic of Keihan; more particularly, after the Keifuku Electric Railroad sold its shares to the Keihan Electric Railway due to the deteriorating conditions caused by the train crash on the Echizen Main Line of the Keifuku Electric Railroad, and became a wholly owned subsidiary of the Keihan Electric Railway, the Eizan Electric Railway has been gradually showing a characteristic of Keihan rather than Keifuku.

Since becoming independent and the opening of Keihan Oto Line in 1989, the Eizan Electric Railway gradually showed a characteristic of Keihan; particularly, after the Keifuku Electric Railroad sold its shares to the Keihan Electric Railway in 2002 due to the deteriorating conditions caused by the train crash on the Echizen Main Line of the Keifuku Electric Railroad, and became a wholly owned subsidiary of the Keihan Electric Railway, the Eizan Electric Railway has been gradually showing a characteristic of Keihan rather than Keifuku.

sen.j: スルッとKANSAIでカードに印字される符号はEZである。
sen.e: A sign EZ is printed on the KANSAI THRU PASS.
The "EZ" symbol is printed on the KANSAI THRU PASS.
The EZ symbol is printed on the KANSAI THRU PASS.

sen.j: 1985年（昭和60年）7月6日 設立。
sen.e: July 6, 1985: The Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. was established.
July 6, 1985: The Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. was established.
July 6, 1985: The Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. was established.

sen.j: 京福電気鉄道全額出資。
sen.e: Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd. fully funded the Eizan Electric Railway.
The Eizan Electric Railway was fully funded by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
The Eizan Electric Railway was fully funded by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 設立時の資本金は1億円。
sen.e: The capital was 100 million yen for the establishment.
The capital used for its establishment was 100 million yen.
The capital used for its establishment was 100 million yen.

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）4月1日 京福電気鉄道から叡山本線・鞍馬線を譲り受け営業開始。
sen.e: On April 1, 1986 the Eizan Electric Railway began operating the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line which were transferred from Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
On April 1, 1986 the Eizan Electric Railway began operating the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line, which were transferred from Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
April 1, 1986: The Eizan Electric Railway began operating the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line, which were transferred from Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 1991年（平成3年）11月29日 京阪電気鉄道により増資（出資比率60%）。
sen.e: On November 29, 1991 the Eizan Electric Railway increased its capital through Keihan Electric Railway (holding 60 % of shares).
On November 29, 1991 the Eizan Electric Railway increased its capital through Keihan Electric Railway (holding 60% of shares).
November 29, 1991: The Eizan Electric Railway increased its capital through Keihan Electric Railway (holding 60% of shares).

sen.j: 資本金2億5000万円となる。
sen.e: The capital was 250 million yen.
The capital was 250 million yen.
The capital was 250 million yen.

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）10月4日 パノラミック電車「きらら」運転開始。
sen.e: Panoramic train 'Kirara' began operating on October 4, 1997.
The panoramic train 'Kirara' began operating on October 4, 1997.
October 4, 1997: The panoramic train 'Kirara' began operating.

sen.j: 2002年（平成14年）3月29日 京阪電気鉄道の完全子会社となる。
sen.e: On March 29, 2002 the Eizan Electric Railway became a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Keihan Electric Railway.
On March 29, 2002 the Eizan Electric Railway became a wholly owned subsidiary of the Keihan Electric Railway.
March 29, 2002: The Eizan Electric Railway became a wholly owned subsidiary of the Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 2004年（平成16年）3月1日 スルッとKANSAI対応カードが全線で利用可能に。
sen.e: On March 1, 2004 the KANSAI THRU PASS and its corresponding card came into service on the entire line.
On March 1, 2004 the KANSAI THRU PASS and its corresponding card came into service on the entire line.
March 1, 2004: The KANSAI THRU PASS and its corresponding cards came into service on the entire line.
sen.cmt: cards複数にしました。年表表記に統一

tit.cmt: 既出記事ではLinesで統一しています。

sen.j: 全線が京都府京都市左京区内にある。
sen.e: The entire line lies within Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
The entire line lies within Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
The entire line lies within Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 各路線の詳細については以下の項目を参照。
sen.e: Refer to the section below for details of each line.
Refer to the section below for details of each line.
Refer to the section below for details of each line.

sen.j: ■叡山電鉄叡山本線 出町柳～八瀬比叡山口 5.6km
sen.e: ■Eizan Electric Railway, Eizan Main Line, Demachiyanagi Station - Yase-Hieizanguchi Station: 5.6 km
■Eizan Electric Railway, Eizan Main Line, Demachiyanagi Station - Yase-Hieizanguchi Station: 5.6 km
Eizan Electric Railway, Eizan Main Line, Demachiyanagi Station - Yase-Hieizanguchi Station: 5.6 km

sen.j: 日本の鉄道ラインカラー一覧は比叡山の森から緑
sen.e: The line's own color is green, which has been chosen to represent Mt. Hiei-zan/Mt. Hiei.
The line's color is green, which has been chosen to represent Mt. Hiei-zan/Mt. Hiei.
The line's color is green, which has been chosen to represent Mt. Hiei (Hiei-zan)

sen.j: 八瀬比叡山口駅からは京福電気鉄道の京福電気鉄道鋼索線・索道で比叡山の山頂まで行ける。
sen.e: The top of Mt. Hiei-zan/Mt. Hiei can be reached by the Eizan Cable of the Keifuku Electric Railroad from Yase-Hieizanguchi Station.
The top of Mt. Hiei-zan/Mt. Hiei can be reached via the Eizan Cable of the Keifuku Electric Railroad from Yase-Hieizanguchi Station.
The top of Mt. Hiei can be reached via the Eizan Cable of the Keifuku Electric Railroad from Yase-Hieizanguchi Station.
sen.cmt: Mt. Hiei-zan/ 削除しました。

sen.j: ■叡山電鉄鞍馬線 宝ヶ池～鞍馬 8.8km
sen.e: ■Eizan Electric Railway, Kurama Line, Takaragaike Station - Kurama Station: 8.8 km
■Eizan Electric Railway, Kurama Line, Takaragaike Station - Kurama Station: 8.8 km
Eizan Electric Railway, Kurama Line, Takaragaike Station - Kurama Station: 8.8 km

sen.j: ラインカラーは貴船・鞍馬山の紅葉から赤
sen.e: The line's own color is red, which has been chosen to represent autumn leaves in Kibune and Mt.Kurama-san/Mt.Kurama.
The line's color is red, which has been chosen to represent autumn leaves in Kibune and Mt. Kurama-san/Mt. Kurama.
The line's color is red, which has been chosen to represent the autumn leaves in Kibune and Mt. Kurama (Kurama-san).

sen.j: 鞍馬駅近くの鞍馬寺には非常に小規模ながら鞍馬山鋼索鉄道（運営主体は鞍馬寺）が走っている。
sen.e: Kurama Cable runs on the premises of the Kurama-dera Temple located near Kurama Station (operated by Kurama-dera Temple).
Kurama Cable runs on the premises of the Kurama-dera Temple, located near Kurama Station (operated by Kurama-dera Temple).
Kurama Cable runs on the premises of the Kurama-dera Temple, located near Kurama Station (operated by Kurama-dera Temple).

sen.j: 多客時は臨時ダイヤで運転されることがあり、特に毎年10月22日に行われる鞍馬の火祭においては事実上唯一の交通機関となり、ほぼ全ての車両をフル稼働させるぐらいの運転となるが、それでもピーク時には鞍馬線二軒茶屋駅 (京都府)以北が単線で線路容量に制約がある関係もあって長蛇の列（乗車までに数時間の待ち時間）となる。
sen.e: The line is operated for a special schedule when there are many passengers: the line is practically the only transportation particularly during Kurama Fire Festival held every October 22, when almost all the cars are employed for operation; but still the passengers have to wait several hours before boarding at peek hour because the Kurama Line, with a limited track capacity, is a single track between Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and stations to the north of Nikenchaya Station.

The line is operated for a special schedule when there are many passengers; it is basically the only transportation, particularly during Kurama Fire Festival held every October 22, when nearly all the cars are employed for operation; but still the passengers have to wait several hours before boarding at peak hour because the Kurama Line, with a limited track capacity, is a single track between Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and stations to the north of Nikenchaya Station.

The line is operated for a special schedule when there are many passengers; it is basically the only transportation, particularly during Kurama Fire Festival held every October 22, when nearly all the cars are employed for operation; but still the passengers have to wait several hours before boarding at peak hour because the Kurama Line, with a limited track capacity, is a single track between Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and stations to the north of Nikenchaya Station.

sen.j: しかし逆にこれにより鞍馬の街がパンクするのを防いでいる一面もある。
sen.e: However, at the same time this prevents the town of Kurama from flooding with people.
However, at the same time this prevents the town of Kurama from flooding with people.
However, at the same time this prevents the town of Kurama from flooding with people.

sen.j: また、2004年1月からは全路線で一部列車を除いて終日ワンマン運転を行っている。
sen.e: Since January 2004, every train has run without a conductor on board on the entire line except for some trains.
Since January 2004 every train throughout the line has run without a conductor on board, except for certain trains.
Since January 2004 every train throughout the line has run without a conductor on board, except for certain trains.

sen.j: 2007年からラインカラーにちなんだ駅名標を順次設置している。
sen.e: Since 2007, station signs have been gradually installed in accordance with the line's own color.
Since 2007, station signs have been gradually installed in accordance with the line's own color.
Since 2007, station signs have been gradually installed in accordance with the line's own color.

sen.j: ラインカラーが取り入れられており、その色の元になったシンボルマークもあしらわれている。
sen.e: The station signs employ the line's own color along with a symbol mark on which the color is based.
The station signs employ the line's color along with a symbol mark on which the color is based.
The station signs employ the line's color along with a symbol mark on which the color is based.

sen.j: また、ローマ字に加えて朝鮮語と中国語の表記もある。
sen.e: The station signs include Korean and Chinese descriptions, as well as English descriptions.
The station signs include Korean and Chinese descriptions as well as English descriptions.
The station signs include Korean and Chinese descriptions as well as English descriptions.

sen.j: 2007年10月時点で半数ほどの駅に設置済みである。
sen.e: As of October 2007, half of the stations have installed a station sign.
As of October 2007, half the stations have installed station signs.
As of October 2007, half the stations have installed station signs.

sen.j: 伝統的に「デナ」「デオ」「デト」といった独特の形式称号が使われている。
sen.e: Traditionally, the type of each rolling stock is uniquely called as 'Dena (デナ),' 'Deo (デオ),' 'Deto (デト)' or the like.
Traditionally, the types of each rolling stock are uniquely called 'Dena (デナ),' 'Deo (デオ),' 'Deto (デト)' or the like.
Traditionally, the types of each rolling stock are uniquely called 'Dena (デナ),' 'Deo (デオ),' 'Deto (デト)' or the like.

sen.j: 営業用車のカタカナの2文字目は「ナ」が中型（なかがた）、「オ」が大型の略称である。
sen.e: As to the type of a car used for passenger service, the second letter of katakana 'na (ナ)' stands for 'nakagada,' meaning a middle size, whereas 'o (オ)' stands for 'ogata,' meaning a large size.
As to the type of car used for passenger service, the second letter of katakana 'na (ナ)' stands for 'nakagada,' meaning a middle size, whereas 'o (オ)' stands for 'ogata,' meaning a large size.
As to the type of car used for passenger service, the second letter of katakana 'na (ナ)' stands for 'nakagata,' meaning a middle size, whereas 'o (オ)' stands for 'ogata,' meaning a large size.

sen.j: なお、1995年のデナ21形廃車により「デナ」は形式消滅している。
sen.e: Note that the type 'Dena (デナ)' disappeared when the car 'Dena Type 21 (デナ21形)' was abandoned in 1995.
Note that the type 'Dena (デナ)' disappeared when the car 'Dena Type 21 (デナ21形)' was abandoned in 1995.
Note that the type 'Dena (デナ)' disappeared when the car 'Dena Type 21 (デナ21形)' was abandoned in 1995.

sen.j: 事業用車の2文字目は日本国有鉄道の貨車に準じていて、京福時代には「デワ」も存在した。
sen.e: As to the type of a car used for operation, the second letter is based on the type of a freight car of Japan National Railways (JNR), and the type 'Dewa (デワ)' also existed during the Keifuku era.
As to the type of car used for operation, the second letter is based on the type of freight car of Japan National Railways (JNR), and the type 'Dewa (デワ)' also existed during the Keifuku era.
As to the type of car used for operation, the second letter is based on the type of freight car of Japan National Railways (JNR), and the type 'Dewa (デワ)' also existed during the Keifuku era.

sen.j: デナ500形を除き全て当線区での新造（実質車体新成含む）車両となっている。
sen.e: Except for Dena Type 500 (デナ500形), all the cars running on the lines are new types (substantially including new car bodies).
Except for the Dena Type 500 (デナ500形), all the cars running on the lines are new types (particularly including new car bodies).
Except for the Dena Type 500, all the cars were newly built for the line (including new bodies).
sen.cmt: 譲り受けではなく、この路線のために新しく作られた、という意味に解釈しました。(デナ500形) を削除

sen.j: これは「デオ」といえども車体長16mクラスの現在の日本においては小型に属する車体であり、車両寿命や冷房化の要求が生じた時点で大手私鉄等から譲り受ける適当な車両がなかったことが大きいとされている。
sen.e: Even though a new type is called 'Deo (デオ),' cars of about 16-meter long fall into a small size in Japan today; this is because when the existing cars became old and had to meet the requirement for air conditioning, the Eizan Electric Railway could not find suitable cars to be transferred from major private railways.

Even though a new type is called 'Deo (デオ),' cars of about 16-meter long fall into a small size in Japan today; this is because when the existing cars became old and had to meet the requirement for air conditioning, the Eizan Electric Railway could not find suitable cars to be transferred from major private railways.

Even 'Deo' of about 16 meters long falls into a small size in Japan today; this is because when the existing cars became old and had to meet the requirement for air conditioning, the Eizan Electric Railway couldn't find suitable cars to be transferred from major private railways.
sen.cmt: new typeは削除しました。(デオ) を削除

sen.j: それゆえに下記のような統一性や「きらら」のような独自の車両を生み出す結果ともなっている。
sen.e: This thus led to the following common feature or creation of a unique car such as 'Kirara.'
This led to the following common feature or he creation of a unique car such as 'Kirara.'
This led to the following common feature or the creation of a unique car such as 'Kirara.'

sen.j: 勾配区間での安全性やメンテナンス面から現存営業用車両は、全て電動車かつ全ての軸が駆動軸であり、抵抗制御と発電ブレーキの組み合わせによる制御となっている。
sen.e: In view of security in the steep slope section and maintenance, all the existing cars for passenger service are motor driven and employ drive shafts, controlled by a combination of resistance control and dynamic braking.

In view of maintenance and security in the steeply sloped section, all the existing cars for passenger service are motor-driven and employ drive shafts, being controlled by a combination of resistance control and dynamic braking.

In view of maintenance and security in the steeply sloped section, all the existing cars for passenger service are motor-driven and employ drive shafts, being controlled by a combination of resistance control and dynamic braking.

sen.j: 予備車となっているデオ600形を除きカルダン駆動、冷房装置付である。
sen.e: Except for a spare car Deo Type 600 (デオ600形), a Cardan driving device and an air conditioner are installed.
Except for a spare car Deo Type 600 (デオ600形), a Cardan driving device and an air conditioner are installed.
Except for a spare car Deo Type 600, a Cardan driving device and an air conditioner are installed.

sen.j: 車体においては無人駅での乗車券収集の便から車端に客用ドアが存在する。
sen.e: A door for passengers is installed near the edge of a car for convenience in collecting tickets at an unmanned station.
A door for passengers is installed near the edge of a car for convenience in collecting tickets at an unmanned station.
A door for passengers is installed near the edge of a car for convenience in collecting tickets at an unmanned station.

sen.j: （2両固定編成のデオ800系、デオ900形では連結面側は少し内側に寄っている）
sen.e: As to Deo Series 800 (デオ800系) and Deo Type 900 (デオ900形) (which comprise two fixed cars), a door on the connection side is placed inward.
As for the Deo Series 800 (デオ800系) and Deo Type 900 (デオ900形) (which comprise two fixed cars), a door on the connection side is placed inward.
As for the Deo Series 800 and Deo Type 900 (which comprise two fixed cars), a door on the connection side is placed inward.

sen.j: また、以前の経緯より現存営業用車両の全てが、かつて存在した、阪神系の武庫川車両工業製造となっているが、部品などでは京阪電気鉄道から譲渡され、再利用しているものも多い。
sen.e: With the previous circumstances, all the existing cars for passenger service were produced by the previous Mukogawa-Sharyo (Hanshin group), while many of the components are transferred from the Keihan Electric Railway and are reused.

With the previous circumstances, all the existing cars for passenger service were produced by the previous Mukogawa-Sharyo (Hanshin group), while many of the components have been transferred from the Keihan Electric Railway and are reused.

With the previous circumstances, all the existing cars for passenger service were produced by the previous Mukogawa-Sharyo (Hanshin group), while many of the components have been transferred from the Keihan Electric Railway and are reused.

sen.j: 叡山本線、鞍馬線を通じて、普通運賃は運賃制度区間制、定期運賃は運賃制度距離制となっている。
sen.e: Through out the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line, a standard fare is based upon the number of sections, whereas a commuter-pass fare is based upon the distance.
Throughout the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line, a standard fare is based on the number of sections, whereas a commuter-pass fare is based on the distance.
Throughout the Eizan Main Line and the Kurama Line, a standard fare is based on the number of sections, whereas a commuter-pass fare is based on the distance.

sen.j: 普通運賃の場合、修学院駅・岩倉駅 (京都府)・二軒茶屋駅 (京都府)・二ノ瀬駅に区界があり、この駅を越えて乗車すると区数が1つ増え運賃が変わる。
sen.e: A standard fare is based upon the number of sections, where an additional section is counted by passing each of Shugakuin, Iwakura (Kyoto Prefecture), Nikenchaya (Kyoto Prefecture), Ninose Stations.

A standard fare is based on the number of sections, where an additional section is counted by passing each of the Shugakuin, Iwakura (Kyoto Prefecture), Nikenchaya (Kyoto Prefecture) and Ninose stations.

A standard fare is based on the number of sections, where an additional section is counted by passing each of the Shugakuin, Iwakura (Kyoto Prefecture), Nikenchaya (Kyoto Prefecture) and Ninose stations.

sen.j: また、鞍馬駅方面から宝ヶ池駅で乗り換えて八瀬比叡山口駅方面に乗り換えた場合や、その反対の場合も区数が1つ増える。
sen.e: An additional section is counted also when boarding the train at Kurama Station to change at Takaragaike Station for Yase-Hieizanguchi Station, or in the opposite case.
An additional section is counted when boarding the train at Kurama Station to change at Takaragaike Station for Yase-Hieizanguchi Station, or in the opposite case.
An additional section is counted when boarding the train at Kurama Station to change at Takaragaike Station for Yase-Hieizanguchi Station, or in the opposite case.

sen.j: このため、たとえば出町柳駅から修学院駅まで乗車した場合は2.9キロメートル乗車しても1区で済むが、八幡前駅 (京都府)から三宅八幡駅まで乗車した場合は、1.5キロの乗車で2区となる。
sen.e: Therefore, boarding from, e.g., Demachiyanagi Station to Shugakuin Station: a distance of 2.9 km corresponds to one section, whereas boarding from Hachiman-mae Station (Kyoto Prefecture) to Miyakehachiman Station: a distance of 1.5 km corresponds to two sections.

Therefore, boarding from, for example Demachiyanagi Station to Shugakuin Station, a distance of 2.9 km corresponds to one section, but when boarding from Hachiman-mae Station (Kyoto Prefecture) to Miyakehachiman Station, a distance of 1.5 km corresponds to two sections.

Therefore, boarding from, for example Demachiyanagi Station to Shugakuin Station, a distance of 2.9 km corresponds to one section, but when boarding from Hachiman-mae Station (Kyoto Prefecture) to Miyakehachiman Station, a distance of 1.5 km corresponds to two sections.

sen.j: 回数券については普通の大人・小人用（普通運賃の10倍で11回）の他に学生割引回数乗車券（大人用のみ・同15回）、敬老割引回数乗車券（同20回）が設定されている。
sen.e: As to commutation tickets, there are standard adult/child tickets (eleven tickets for the fare equal to ten standard tickets), student discount commutation tickets (adult tickets only, fifteen tickets for the fare equal to ten standard tickets), and (twenty tickets for the fare equal to ten standard tickets).

As for commutation tickets, there are standard adult/child tickets (eleven tickets for the fare equal to ten standard tickets), student discount commutation tickets (adult tickets only, fifteen tickets for the fare equal to ten standard tickets), and (twenty tickets for the fare equal to ten standard tickets).

As for commuter tickets, there are standard adult/child tickets (eleven tickets for the fare equal to ten standard tickets), student discount commuter tickets (adult tickets only, fifteen tickets for the fare equal to ten standard tickets), and discount commuter tickets for elderly (adult tickets only, twenty tickets for the fare equal to ten standard tickets).
sen.cmt: 敬老割引の訳を discount commutation tickets for elderly とし、補いました。

sen.j: 京阪との初乗り区間相互間（元田中～修学院と京阪・丸太町～四条）に大人20円・小人10円の割引が設定されている（事前に自動券売機での連絡乗車券購入が必要。
sen.e: For a mutual base fare section with Keihan (Mototanaka Station - Shugakuin Station and Keihan Jingu-marutamachi Station - Gion-shijo Station), a discount of 20 yen for an adult or 10 yen for a child is applied (passengers are required to buy a connection ticket in advance at an automatic ticket machine;

sen.j: 叡山電鉄側からの場合、自動券売機稼動時間以外は出町柳駅改札で発売される。
sen.e: for passengers boarding from the Eizan Electric Railway, the ticket is sold at a ticket gate on the Demachiyanagi Station during the out-of-service hours of the automatic ticket machine;
For passengers boarding from the Eizan Electric Railway, the ticket is sold at a ticket gate on the Demachiyanagi Station during the out-of-service hours of the automatic ticket machine.

sen.cmt: ticket gate at としました。

sen.j: なお、スルッとKANSAIの場合は自動的に割引額で引き落とされる）。
sen.e: in case of the KANSAI THRU PASS, a discount fare is automatically deducted).
In the case of the KANSAI THRU PASS, a discount fare is automatically deducted).
In the case of the KANSAI THRU PASS, a discount fare is automatically deducted).

sen.j: 出町柳駅では駅員が常駐しており、自動改札機・自動券売機も常に稼動している。
sen.e: At Demachiyanagi Station, staff is always stationed, and automatic ticket gates and automatic ticket machines are always in operation.
sen.cmt: 英辞郎 on the WEB、プログレッシブ和英中辞典
sen.e: Staff are always stationed at Demachiyanagi Station, and automatic ticket gates and automatic ticket machines are always in operation.
Staff are always stationed at Demachiyanagi Station, and automatic ticket gates and automatic ticket machines are always in operation.

sen.j: 鞍馬駅では始発・終電近くで無人となるほか駅員が駐在しており、その間は自動改札機も稼動する。
sen.e: At Kurama Station, staff is stationed except for the time around the first and last trains, and automatic ticket gates are in operation while staff is stationed.
At Kurama Station, staff are stationed except for the times around the first and last trains, and automatic ticket gates are in operation while staff are stationed.
At Kurama Station, staff are stationed except for the times around the first and last trains, and automatic ticket gates are in operation while staff are stationed.

sen.j: 他の駅では常に駅員（出札・集改札要員）が駐在している駅はない。
sen.e: Except for the above stations, staff (a ticket clerk and a ticket examiner) is not stationed.
Except for the above stations, staff (a ticket clerk and a ticket examiner) are not stationed.
Except for the above stations, staff (a ticket clerk and a ticket examiner) are not stationed.

sen.j: なお、貴船口駅や八瀬比叡山口駅では観光客が多い時期に駅員が駐在するほか、時間を限って駅員が出張してくる駅もある。
sen.e: Incidentally, at Kibuneguchi Station and Yase-Hieizanguchi Station, staff is stationed during the tourist season, while at some other stations, staff is stationed for only a limited time.
Incidentally, at Kibuneguchi Station and Yase-Hieizanguchi Station, staff are stationed during the tourist season, while at some other stations staff are stationed only at limited times.
Incidentally, at Kibuneguchi Station and Yase-Hieizanguchi Station, staff are stationed during the tourist season, while at some other stations staff are stationed only at limited times.

sen.j: 乗車時は有人駅では自動券売機で切符を購入し、自動改札機に切符を通す。
sen.e: At a manned station, passengers buy a ticket at the automatic ticket machine and pass it through the automatic ticket gate.
At a manned station, passengers buy tickets at the automatic ticket machine and pass them through the automatic ticket gate.
At a manned station, passengers buy tickets at the automatic ticket machine and pass them through the automatic ticket gate.

sen.j: 無人駅のほとんどでは駅での改札はなく、乗車時に電車の乗車口に設置された整理券発行機から整理券を取るか、スルッとKANSAI共通カードをカードリーダーに通し、乗車駅を記録させる。
sen.e: Most of the unmanned stations are not equipped with a ticket gate, and thus passengers take a numbered ticket from a numbered ticket issuing machine installed at the entrance of the train when boarding, or pass their KANSAI THRU PASS through a card reader to have the station name where they board recorded on their card.

Most of the unmanned stations aren't equipped with ticket gates, and thus passengers take a numbered ticket from a numbered ticket issuing machine installed at the entrance of the train when boarding, or pass the KANSAI THRU PASS through a card reader in order to have the station name where they board recorded on their card.

Most of the unmanned stations aren't equipped with ticket gates, and thus passengers take a numbered ticket from a numbered ticket issuing machine installed at the entrance of the train when boarding, or pass the KANSAI THRU PASS through a card reader in order to have the station name where they board recorded on their card.

sen.j: 無人駅でも時間を限って自動券売機がある駅もあり、そのような駅で予め切符を購入した場合は、そのまま乗車すればよい。
sen.e: Some unmanned stations are equipped with an automatic ticket machine in operation for a limited time; when passengers buy a ticket in advance at an unmanned station, they may just board the train with the ticket.

Some unmanned stations are equipped with automatic ticket machines in operation for a limited time; when passengers buy tickets in advance at an unmanned station, they may just board the train with the ticket.

Some unmanned stations are equipped with automatic ticket machines in operation for a limited time; when passengers buy tickets in advance at an unmanned station, they may just board the train with the ticket.

sen.j: 一部の駅では自動改札の内側に自動券売機があるが、現金の場合は改札の横を通り抜けてホームに入り切符を購入すればよい（戻って自動改札に通す必要はない）
sen.e: In some stations, an automatic ticket machine is installed inside the automatic ticket gate; passengers can buy a ticket with cash on the platform by passing the ticket gate, and do not need to return to the automatic ticket gate to pass the ticket.

In some stations, automatic ticket machines are installed inside the automatic ticket gate; passengers can buy tickets with cash on the platform by passing the ticket gate, but they don't need to return to the automatic ticket gate in order to pass the ticket.

In some stations, automatic ticket machines are installed inside the automatic ticket gate; passengers can buy tickets with cash on the platform by passing the ticket gate, but they don't need to return to the automatic ticket gate in order to pass the ticket.

sen.j: 下車時に有人駅では改札口で現金を払うか、自動改札機に切符、またはスルッとKANSAI共通カードを通す。
sen.e: At manned stations, passengers buy a ticket with cash at the ticket gate, or pass the ticket or the KANSAI THRU PASS through an automatic ticket gate.
At manned stations, passengers buy tickets with cash at the ticket gate or pass the ticket or the KANSAI THRU PASS through an automatic ticket gate.
At manned stations, passengers buy tickets with cash at the ticket gate or pass the ticket or the KANSAI THRU PASS through an automatic ticket gate.

sen.j: 無人駅では運転席横の運賃箱に整理券と現金を投入するか切符を投入する。
sen.e: At unmanned stations, passengers put a numbered ticket with money or a ticket into a fare collecting box beside the driver's seat.
At unmanned stations, the passenger puts a numbered ticket with money or a ticket into a fare collection box beside the driver's seat.
At unmanned stations, the passenger puts a numbered ticket with money or a ticket into a fare collection box beside the driver's seat.

sen.j: 整理券には乗車駅を示すパターンが印刷されており、下車駅では自動的に運賃額を運賃箱に表示させることができる。
sen.e: A pattern indicating a station where a passenger boards is printed on the numbered ticket, thereby the fare is automatically displayed on the fare collecting box at a station where a passenger gets off.

A pattern indicating a station where a passenger boards is printed on the numbered ticket, whereby the fare is automatically displayed on the fare collection box at the station where the passenger disembarks.

A pattern indicating a station where a passenger boards is printed on the numbered ticket, whereby the fare is automatically displayed on the fare collection box at the station where the passenger disembarks.

sen.j: スルッとKANSAI共通カードはカードリーダーに通す。
sen.e: Passengers pass the KANSAI THRU PASS through the card reader.
Passengers pass the KANSAI THRU PASS through the card reader.
Passengers pass the KANSAI THRU PASS through the card reader.

sen.j: 定期券は運転士に提示する。
sen.e: Passengers show a commuter ticket to the driver.
The passenger shows a commuter ticket to the driver.
The passenger shows a commuter pass to the driver.

sen.j: 無人駅での乗車口は後ドア、降車口は前ドアとなっている。
sen.e: At unmanned station, an entrance to the train is the rear door, whereas an exit to the platform is the front door.
At an unmanned station, the entrance to the train is the rear door, whereas the exit to the platform is the front door.
At an unmanned station, the entrance to the train is the rear door, whereas the exit to the platform is the front door.

sen.j: 3ドア車両の中ドアと2両編成の場合の後の車両のドアは有人扱いの駅を除き締切である。
sen.e: The middle door of a three-door car and the door of the second car when a train comprises two cars are kept closed except at manned station.
The middle door of a three-door car and the door of the second car when a train comprises two cars are kept closed, except at manned stations.
The middle door of a three-door car and the door of the second car when a train comprises two cars are kept closed, except at manned stations.

sen.j: 運賃箱やカードリーダー、整理券発行器は進行方向左側のドア横のみに設置されている。
sen.e: The fare collecting box, the card reader, the numbered ticket issuing machine are all installed beside the door on the left side to the direction of travel.
The fare collection box, the card reader and the numbered ticket issuing machine are all installed beside the door on the left side toward the direction of travel.
The fare collection box, the card reader and the numbered ticket issuing machine are all installed beside the door on the left side toward the direction of travel.

sen.j: 出町柳駅・鞍馬駅の窓口及び修学院駅の定期券売場では、1000円（小児500円）で全線が1日乗り放題になる「1日乗車券 えぇきっぷ」を発売している。
sen.e: One-day Pass for Eizan Railways 'Ee Kippu' is sold for 1,000 yen (child: 500 yen) at a ticket office at Demachiyanagi and Kurama Stations and at a commuter ticket office at Shugakuin Station.
The one-day pass for Eizan Railways 'Ee Kippu' is sold for 1,000 yen (child: 500 yen) at a ticket office at Demachiyanagi and Kurama Stations and at a commuter ticket office at Shugakuin Station.
The one-day pass for Eizan Railways 'Ee Kippu' is sold for 1,000 yen (child: 500 yen) at a ticket office at Demachiyanagi and Kurama Stations and at a commuter pass office at Shugakuin Station.

sen.j: 提示するだけで沿線社寺や観光施設で拝観料・入場料の割り引きを受けたり、粗品の進呈を受けたり、沿線の飲食店・土産物店で特典を受けることができる。
sen.e: Only by representing the 'Ee Kippu,' a discount admission fee or entrance fee is applied at shrines, temples, or sightseeing facilities along the lines, a free gift is given, or a specific benefit is offered at restaurants or souvenir shops along the lines.

Only by representing the 'Ee Kippu,' a discount admission fee or entrance fee is applied at shrines, temples or sightseeing facilities along the lines, a free gift is given, or a specific benefit is offered at restaurants or souvenir shops along the lines.

Only by presenting the 'Ee Kippu,' a discount admission fee or entrance fee is applied at shrines, temples or sightseeing facilities along the lines, a free gift is given, or a specific benefit is offered at restaurants or souvenir shops along the lines.

sen.j: 通用日は自動改札機または車内のカードリーダーを通すことによって、裏面に印刷され決定する。
sen.e: The expiration date is printed on the back of the 'Ee Kippu' when passing it through the automatic ticket gate or the card reader on the train.
The expiration date is printed on the back of the 'Ee Kippu' when passing it through the automatic ticket gate or the card reader on the train.
The expiration date is printed on the back of the 'Ee Kippu' when passing it through the automatic ticket gate or the card reader on the train.

sen.j: 無人駅での乗車時には最初の乗車時以外カードリーダーに通す必要はないが、無人駅での下車時には必ずカードリーダーに通す必要がある。
sen.e: When boarding the train at an unmanned station, passengers are required to pass it through the card reader only upon boarding for the first time, but when getting off the train at an unmanned station, all passengers are required to pass it through the card reader.

When boarding the train at an unmanned station, the passenger is required to pass it through the card reader only upon boarding for the first time, but when getting off the train at an unmanned station each passenger is required to pass it through the card reader.
